title: Hokkaido
summary: Hokkaidō (Japanese: 北海道, Hepburn: Hokkaidō, literally "Northern Sea Circuit" or "Northern Sea Region", pronounced [hokkaidoː]), officially Hokkaidō Circuit Prefecture, is the second largest island of Japan and comprises the largest and northernmost prefecture.[1] The Tsugaru Strait separates Hokkaidō from Honshu; the two islands are connected by the undersea railway Seikan Tunnel.
